caption.p: Histograms of extreme El Niño counts in different forcing regime ensembles. Fifty 50-year sections of the unforced, control CESM simulation (blue), the 50 CESM ensemble members from 1940–1990 (black), the 50 CESM ensemble members from 2040–2090 (red). Extreme El Niño events defined here as trend-removed Niño3.4 index greater than 1.75 standard deviations above mean. For reference, the count of extreme El Niño events in reconstructed observations (ERSST v3b) from 1940–1990 using this calculation is 6. The box-whisker plot above shows 5 th, 25 th, 50 th, 75 th, and 95 th percentiles. Notches indicate a rough 95% confidence interval for the difference between two medians.
